intro: Lithocarpus vidalianus, commonly known as the Philippine stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts. It is a broadleaf evergreen tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its hard, woody fruits and leathery, elliptical leaves that are often dark green in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland to montane forests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
